programme.title: The Colours of China
programme.desc: Five colours are an integral part of contemporary China and the ancient philosophy of Wu Xing. Each episode takes us to regions where we meet our characters, learn how Wu Xing sits in their lives and explore the landscapes they live in.

programme.title: Gourmet Escapes
programme.desc: Newfoundland, Canada is blessed with fish, wildlife, post card like scenery and great people. Chef Massimo Capra finally catches big fish that will be on the menu when he teams up with chef Nathan Orton and together prepare a meal known locally as a “Boil Up”- it’s a Newfoundland tradition. They invite a few friends and cook over an open fire and camping stoves on a small island. Friends just pull ip in their boats and join in the meal.

programme.title: It’s How You Get There
programme.desc: Sam, Julian, and Jenn experience a variety of exciting modes of transportation as they journey across the country. They use things such as trucks, cars and motorcycles, and they also experiment with ATVs, boats, jet skis, and air travel. Each episode features their competition with each other, including wagers, witty banter and adrenaline to keep the viewers entertained. They are continuously learning as they try out these new modes to see which one they consider the best. This is "It's How You Get There".

programme.title: American Travelers
programme.desc: Dave & Kari visit the Dominican Republic and explore the town of Samana, then go to Bacardi Island.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: Raw Travel
programme.desc: There is a lot to love about the laid back destination of Honduras. Raw Travel explores the little known Garifuna culture and some of Central America’s best beaches and coral reefs for one of the most incredible and economical scuba destinations around.

programme.desc: Newfoundland, Canada is blessed with fish, wildlife, post card like scenery and great people. Chef Massimo Capra finally catches big fish that will be on the menu when he teams up with chef Nathan Orton and together prepare a meal known locally as a “Boil Up”- it’s a Newfoundland tradition. They invite a few friends and cook over an open fire and camping stoves on a small island. Friends just pull ip in their boats and join in the meal.

programme.title: Take A Seat: Egypt
programme.desc: An introduction to Dominic and the backdrop to the Take A Seat Egypt Story; The revolution. Dominic leaves Cairo on his Tandem alone and after 4 days on the road, he meets his first companion, Ayman a photographer, in Alexandria. They cycle together for three days before the trepidation of cycling into the Sahara desert.

programme.title: Take A Seat: Egypt
programme.desc: Dominic and Ayman suffer less than 130 degrees of heat in the desert. Eventually they are refreshed when they make it to an oasis. Ayman heads back to support the revolution while Dominic is forced to continue in the camera vehicle due to military restrictions near Libya.

programme.title: Take A Seat: Egypt
programme.desc: In the Baharya Oasis, Dominic finds Ossam, a gentleman who waits until they’re riding to tell Dominic that he nearly died when he was lost in the desert at eight years old. After a spectacular 2-day journey, Tarek, a journalist from Cairo who wants to experience the tandem adventure, replaces Ossam. However, after only 24 hours, Tarek succumbs to the heat of the sun, and rides in the camera vehicle. Dominic pushes on alone and comes dangerously close to collapse with no shade for miles.

programme.title: Take A Seat: Egypt
programme.desc: Ossam returns to help Dominic to Luxor. After suffering stomach trouble, fighting headwinds and being forced to cycle at night to avoid the heat, the pair arrive on the banks of the river Nile in Luxor and explore the river and the ancient ruins.

programme.title: Take A Seat: Egypt
programme.desc: Ahmed, a 'professional' cyclist, meets up with Dominic and rides with him to the Red Sea. Along the way he gains strength from praying on the roadside and talks of his personal experiences in Tahrir Square, which is the heart of the revolution. After a windy boat crossing across the Red Sea, they arrive in the Promised Land, the Sinai Peninsula.

programme.title: Take A Seat: Egypt
programme.desc: Ahmed swaps out with John, a wiry Coptic Christian from Alexandria. He helps Dominic up the steep hills of Egypt’s only mountain range to the ancient and significant St Catherine's Monastery and Mt Sinai. Aided by a camel, they climb the mountain and reflect on the last 10 days of the journey to come.

programme.title: Take A Seat: Egypt
programme.desc: John cycles with Dominic to Suez, where he swaps with the adventure's only female companion, Jasmine. She flies in the face of the traditional Middle Eastern female role by accepting this physical challenge and toughs out the last 3 days of the entire journey while recounting her own experiences in Tahrir Square during the revolution. This is also the journey's destination, and here we reflect on Egypt's future, uncertain, but for the strength and tenacity of its youth, which Dominic has experienced first hand.

programme.title: Take A Seat: Egypt
programme.desc: An introduction to Dominic and the backdrop to the Take A Seat Egypt Story; The revolution. programme.title: American Travelers
programme.sub-title: American Travelers: Lake Tahoe Lake of the Sky
programme.desc: Dave & Kari visit Lake Tahoe, California and check out the Sierra Boat Company.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: Raw Travel
programme.desc: For some travelers, the rush of travel is enough but others need more. Raw Travel invites viewers to sample the growing eco & adventure travel movement with “Raw Adrenaline”.
